story.storykicker: Just carrying that trusty tube of sunscreen is not enough.
story.storybody:
That beach holiday is finally around the corner, and you've already decided what you're going to wear when. You've dusted that sarong, the flip-flops are in the suitcase, and that toiletry kit is just missing sunscreen. But before you zip up that bag and board the flight, keep this in mind: that lone tube of sunscreen won't be enough to protect your skin (and hair!) from the humid weather.

Also read: 5 of the best nude beaches around the world

So then what's a traveller to do? Sit back, relax, and read this short guide to beauty essentials for the beach bum:

Essential #1: Sunscreen spray
No, your usual tube is not enough--until and unless you plan to spend half an hour each day rubbing greasy sunscreen on your limbs and torso; or worse yet, want a glamorous sunburn. And if you're wondering why that spray isn't good enough for your face, it's because most sunscreen sprays contain aerosol and other such chemicals that you don't want on your mug. {mosimage}

Now that's that sorted, try Neutrogena Ultra Sheer Body Mist Sunscreen SPF 30, Rs 675 (available at Amazon.in). Spray the product on your arms, legs, and other exposed parts, and gently massage till the product is absorbed.

Essential #2: BB cream with SPF
Before you go accusing this beauty writer and perennial beach bum of bombarding you with too many products, hear me out: you need about a teaspoon of sunscreen to get the sun protection the SPF label promises. But the more you sunscreen you apply, the greasier your skin looks. {mosimage}

An easier solution? Apply the usual amount of sunscreen, and layer it up with a BB cream with SPF for optimum protection, like Bobbi Brown BB Cream SPF 35, Rs 3,800 (available at Bobbi Brown stores across the country).

Essential #3: Lip balm with SPF
Chances are you already own a stick which boasts of SPF. But if you don't (and are rolling your eyes while reading this), know that the skin on your lips is much thinner than the rest of your face. Which without SPF can translate to a dark, damaged, and scorched pout. {mosimage}

Your choices are limitless, you can choose medicated lip balms with an SPF 30 if you've got very sensitive skin; or try The Body Shop Vitamin E Lip Care, Rs 350 (available at The Body Shop stores across the country). Apply it underneath your favourite lippy, or whip it out when your pout feels dry.

Essential #4: After-sun moisturiser
Baby it's damn hot outside, and even with all that SPF on your chances are your skin's going to get damaged. It's first sign: that burning, tingling sensation that takes over your face when you head indoors after a sunny session. {mosimage}

To keep your skin fit and fine, wash your face with a gentle cleanser and moisturise with a soothing facial lotion, which contains ingredients like aloe vera. Try Plum Hello Aloe Caring Day Moisturiser, Rs 450 (available at Plumgoodness.com).

Essential #5: Frizz-control serum
Long hair, don't care? You will once you're at the beach. Humidity has this nasty habit of bringing out the worst in even the most manageable mane. Which is why you must carry a non-greasy, frizz-fighting serum with you that can make your hair behave, and add an enviable shine. Try Tigi Bed Head Control Freak Serum, Rs 900 (available at Amazon.in) {mosimage}
